intro: Draba magadanensis, commonly known as the Magadan whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant species native to the cold regions of Eastern Siberia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Draba magadanensis is known for its ability to survive in harsh, arctic-like conditions, showcasing remarkable adaptability to extreme climates. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a touch of color to the otherwise barren landscape.
